thread.title: Can Lockheed spur interest in DHS's cyber services program?
thread.title_full: Can Lockheed spur interest in DHS's cyber services program?

title: Can Lockheed spur interest in DHS's cyber services program?
text:
23 Can Lockheed spur interest in DHS's cyber services program? 
Federal Times: The Department of Homeland Security added contracting giant Lockheed Martin to its list of commercial providers authorized to sell services using cyber threat information — both classified and not — collected by the government. Whether that will inspire businesses to sign on remains to be seen.Lockheed joins the telecoms AT&T, CenturyLink and Verizon, which have been on the list since DHS launched the Enhanced Cybersecurity Services (ECS) program two years ago.
